info.title: Bitbucket
info.description: Bitbucket is a web based hosting service for projects that use GIT revision control.

get.description: Triggers when a new repository is created for the authenticated account.
get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, create a new repository.

post.summary: When a new issue is added
post.description: Triggers when a new issue is added to the given repository.
post.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, create an issue.

post.description: Triggers when an issue is updated in the given repository.
post.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, update an issue.

post.summary: When a pull request is approved
post.description: Triggers when a pullreqest is approved in the specified repository.
post.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, approve a pull request.

post.summary: When a pull request is created
post.description: Triggers when a new pullreqest is created in the given repository.
post.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, create a pull request.

post.summary: When a pull request is declined
post.description: Triggers when an existing pullreqest is declined in the given repository.
post.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, decline a pull request.

post.summary: When a pull request is merged
post.description: Triggers when an existing pullreqest is merged in the given repository.
post.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, merge a pull request.

post.summary: When a new commit is pushed
post.description: Triggers when a new commit is pushed to the given repository.
post.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, push a commit.

delete.description: Delete a hook in a given repo.

post.description: This operation creates a new issue in the given repository.

get.description: This operation retrieves all information about the given issue.
This operation returns a list of the last 100 pull requests for the given repo.

post.description: This operation is used to approve an existing pull request.
This operation is used to decline an existing pull request.
This operation can merge a given pull request.

get.description: This operation returns a list of all repositories in your account
This operation returns all information about a given user by its id.

priority.description: The priority category of the issue.
The priority category of the issue.

name.description: A component value defined by the administrator.
A milestone value defined by the administrator.
A version value defined by the administrator.

scm.description: Source control manager for the repository.

website.description: Url of the website if defined.

has_wiki.description: True if the repository has a wiki.

fork_policy.description: Allow forks, no public forks or no forks.

language.description: Programming language used in the repository.

has_issues.description: True if an issue tracker has been set for the repository.

display_name.description: Display name of the repository's owner.

uuid.description: Unique identifier of the repository's owner.

size.description: Integer indicating size of the repository in bytes.

slug.description: Slug used to identify the repository.

is_private.description: True if the repository is private.

role.description: The role of the pull request.

type.description: The type of the pull request.

display_name.description: The display name of the approver.

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier of the user.

approved.description: True if the pull request is approved.

name.description: The name of the destination branch.

hash.description: The SHA1 of the destination branch head.

name.description: The name of the destination branch repository.

uuid.description: The UUID of the destination branch repository.

type.description: The type of the destination branch repository.

username.description: Username of person who closed the PR.

display_name.description: Name of person who closed the PR.

type.description: Closed by a user or team.

uuid.description: Unique identifier of person who closed the PR.

hash.description: The SHA1 of the source branch head.

name.description: The name of the source branch repository.

uuid.description: The UUID of the source branch repository.

type.description: The type of the source branch repository.

display_name.description: The display name of the creator.

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier of the creator.

reason.description: The reason the pull request is declined (if so).

id.description: The Id of the pull request.

full_name.description: The full name of the repository.

uuid.description: The Universally Unique Identifier of the repository.

display_name.description: The display name of the reporter.

uuid.description: The Universally Unique Identifier of the reporter.

votes.description: The number of votes on the issue.

watches.description: The number of watches on the issue.

markup.description: The description markup of the issue.

html.description: The description html of the issue.

assignee.description: The assigned user of the issue.

name.description: A version value defined by the administrator.

display_name.description: The display name of the user.

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier of the user.

display_name.description: Full display name of the author.

uuid.description: Unique identifier of the user or team.

display_name.description: The display name of the approver.

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier of the approver.

new.description: New value for the issue field.

old.description: Old value for the issue field.

markup.description: The description markup of the comment.

html.description: The description html of the comment.

assignee.description: Username of the person issue has been assigned to.

kind.description: Issue kind as defined in the GUI.

reviewers.description: List of reviewers on the pull request.

closed_by.description: Username of person who closes the pull request.

name.description: The name of the destination branch.

hash.description: The SHA1 of the destination branch head.

name.description: Name of the repo where issue is created.

type.description: Type of the repo where issue is created.

merge_commit.description: The SHA1 of the commit when the pull request merges.

close_source_branch.description: Closes the source branch after merge.

display_name.description: Display name of the PR author.

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier of the author.
The universally unique identifier of the user.

hash.description: The SHA1 of the source branch head.

name.description: The name of the source branch repository.

uuid.description: The UUID of the source branch repository.

type.description: The type of the source branch repository.

state.description: The status of the pull request.

reason.description: Reason the pull request is declined (if so).

title.description: The name of the pull request.

created.description: Indicate whether the reference is new.

truncated.description: Indicate whether Bitbucket truncated the commits array in this payload.

closed.description: Indicate whether the reference is old.

forced.description: Indicate whether the push was forced.

display_name.description: The display name of the owner.

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier of the owner.

scm.description: The source control manager of the repository.

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier of the repository.

full_name.description: The full name of the repository.

is_private.description: A boolean indicating if the repository is private.

pullrequestId__in_path.name: pullrequestId
pullrequestId__in_path.description: The Id of the pull request.
